intro: Uragoga ypanemensis, commonly known as the Ypanemense Urara, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil to grow successfully. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
